intro: Scrophularia rudolfii, commonly known as the desert monkeyflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Scrophularia rudolfii is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
